title: CDC Director Rochelle Walensky admits her agency made critical mistakes regarding COVID vaccines
cleaned_text:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Rochelle Walensky recently came out to say that her agency made mistakes with regard to the Wuhan coronavirus (COVID-19) vaccines.

“It was clear that the advice from the CDC was erratic, it was inconsistent [and] it was dictatorial. And we know this, because we got to the point of wearing masks on airplanes,” Dr. Peter McCullough told InfoWars founder Alex Jones.

Just last month, Walensky admitted the agency’s shortcomings after seeing preliminary findings from the CDC’s COVID-19 response reviews. “To be frank, we are responsible for some pretty dramatic, pretty public mistakes, from testing to data to communications. This is our watershed moment. We must pivot,” she said in a video.

McCullough noted that the CDC should have never given any advice or guidance on contagion control. After all, this is in the realm of doctors and healthcare workers who look after patients.

They never should have given guidance or advice on emergency uses of vaccines because while they have established general childhood vaccine schedules, they are out of their league when it comes to pandemics. (Related: CDC sued for hiding COVID vaccine safety data.)

Many people have died because of the COVID-19 vaccines, and now the CDC is saying that it got things wrong. “There’s no review. They’re just greenlighting everything,” McCullough said of the CDC.

There are three false claims about COVID-19 vaccines. The first is that the vaccines stop the infection; the second is that the vaccines block transmission; and the third is that the vaccines prevent hospitalizations.

All of them proved false as many vaccinated individuals got infected with, transmitted and died from COVID-19. (Related: CDC admits to deliberately withholding incriminating COVID jab data from the public to minimize “vaccine hesitancy.”)

McCullough said: “So the idea is that the vaccines never reduced hospitalization and death. There never was a prospective randomized trial with hospitalization and death as a primary endpoint, where that was reduced by the vaccines.”

He pointed out that the only two interventions that reduced hospitalizations and deaths are natural immunity for having the illness beforehand and then early treatment.

“So those are a series of fraudulent studies that didn’t account for natural immunity in early treatment, claiming that the vaccinated had lower rates of hospitalization and death,” McCullough went on.

According to McCullough, those who had been vaccinated are also the ones most fearful of COVID-19. “They were usually the first ones to get early treatment,” he said.

And then, there is data coming from different parts of the globe that the fully vaccinated ones are doing far worse with COVID than those who had been unvaccinated.

Visit Vaccines.news for more news about the dangers and adverse effects of COVID-19 vaccines.

Watch the video below and listen to the conversation between Dr. Peter McCullough and Alex Jones as they break down the latest data showing vaccine-related deaths around the world.

This video is from the InfoWars channel on Brighteon.com.
